metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1882 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s pipes functionalityin how a user performs manipulations with the pipe post_one_notification()after free_pipe_info() that is already called. This flaw allows a localuser to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1882` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
